intro: Cissampelos capitata, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
